description: Kit identifier/name used by inventory and work orders to reference a predefined set of components. Typically unique within the kit master.
Short description of the kitâ€™s contents or specification for purchasing and maintenance users.
Vehicle/unit type, apparatus, or subfleet this kit applies to. Likely a category tag rather than a specific asset; confirm with SME.
Average cost of the complete kit, derived from component prices or recent purchase history. Used for budgeting, valuation, and default costing.
Status flag indicating whether the kit is active and available for use in transactions. Commonly Y/N.
Username or ID of the person or process that created the kit record.
Date and time the kit record was created.
Username or ID of the person who last modified the kit record.
Date and time the kit record was last updated.
Owning application or workgroup associated with the record. Used for segregation, security, or integration; confirm with SME.
